headline: 2 people plunge to their deaths from scenic point at Utah national park - National | Globalnews.ca
context: Two people have died after a 116-metre fall from a viewing area in southern Utah’s Bryce Canyon National Park.
Tourists spotted the bodies on Tuesday below Inspiration Point after the two hikers fell late Monday or early Tuesday, according to the Garfield County Sheriff’s Office.

annotations.paragraph: According to the National Park Service’s website, Inspiration Point is an area that “provides a birds-eye view of the world’s largest collection of rock spires called ‘hoodoos’ found within the Bryce Amphitheater.”
annotations.reason: Provides context about the location where the incident occurred.

annotations.paragraph: Police say it is unknown how the man and woman fell but noted that they had crossed over safety railings and that they had their cat with them, who survived the fall.
annotations.reason: Offers details about the circumstances of the fall and the survival of the cat.

annotations.paragraph: Park rangers, search and rescue teams and a helicopter crew helped recover the bodies. The cat “was found in a black soft-sided carrier that was dirty and torn, but seemed to have weathered the fall fairly well,” according to the Best Friends Animal Society.
annotations.reason: Describes the recovery efforts and condition of the cat, adding to the narrative.
